definitions.definition: the act or ceremony of burying a dead body

examples.text: Her body was sent home for burial.
His family insisted he should be given a proper burial.
His body was returned home for burial.
There were objections to the body's burial in consecrated ground.
We want to give him a decent burial.
preventing the body's burial in consecrated ground

wordOrigin: Old English byrgels ‘place of burial, grave’ (interpreted as plural in Middle English, hence the loss of the final -s), of Germanic origin; related to bury.
